content: Obama wants exit plan strategy in Afghanistan He says a comprehensive approach, not just military action, is needed WASHINGTON - A comprehensive strategy in Afghanistan — including an exit plan — is key to America's "No. 1 mission" of preventing an attack on the U.S., its interests or its allies, President Barack Obama said in an interview broadcast Sunday. "What we can't do is think that just a military approach in Afghanistan is going to be able to solve our problems," the president said on CBS' "60 Minutes." "So what we're looking for is a comprehensive strategy. And there's got to be an exit strategy. There's got to be a sense that this is not perpetual drift." >http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/29828155/
reply: Obama wants exit plan strategy in Afghanistan He says a comprehensive approach, not just military action, is needed WASHINGTON - A comprehensive strategy in Afghanistan — including an exit plan — is key to America's "No. 1 mission" of preventing an attack on the U.S., its interests or its allies, President Barack Obama said in an interview broadcast Sunday. "What we can't do is think that just a military approach in Afghanistan is going to be able to solve our problems," the president said on CBS' "60 Minutes." "So what we're looking for is a comprehensive strategy. And there's got to be an exit strategy. There's got to be a sense that this is not perpetual drift." >http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/29828155/
title: Obama wants exit plan strategy in Afghanistan

content: Do we really want to be there forever? I know! Maybe we could come up with some "goals" to reach like Bush did, then when we achieve those goals we'll just come up with some new ones so we can stay there longer. We are no longer liberators we are occupiers. Same thing in Iraq. If we are going to fight then, by God, take the gloves off and fight! Get it over with and bring them home. "The price of freedom is eternal vigilance." Thomas Jefferson

content: Obama's been suckered into the 'long war' and there's SFA he can do about it. Let's hope it helps the economic recovery. Jeff Huber's latest on the topic is interesting. If it wasn't for the fact that he knows the lifestyle, it would be ludicrous. But the boys eat and breathe the stuff of which wars - especially long wars - are made. They're fightin' generals, not necessarily winnin' generals. >http://zenhuber.blogspot.com "Long War Generals
